people.name: Giuseppe Santarelli
people.description: Giuseppe Santarelli  was an Italian castrato, composer, choir conductor, voice teacher, and Roman Catholic priest.

people.name: Otto von Habsburg
people.description: Otto von Habsburg , also known by his royal name as Archduke Otto of Austria, was the last Crown Prince of Austria-Hungary from 1916 until the dissolution of the empire in 1919, a realm which comprised modern-day Austria, Hungary, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Slovenia, and parts of Italy, Montenegro, Poland, Romania, Serbia and Ukraine.

people.name: Joseph Nduhirubusa
people.description: Joseph Nduhirubusa  was the Roman Catholic bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Ruyigi, Burundi.

people.name: Álvaro del Portillo
people.description: Luminaries such as Pope John Paul II and Cardinal Carlo Caffarra.

people.name: Josemaría Escrivá
people.description: Saint Josemaría Escrivá de Balaguer  was a Roman Catholic priest from Spain who founded Opus Dei, an organization of laypeople and priests dedicated to the teaching that everyone is called to holiness and that ordinary life is a path to sanctity.

people.name: Cláudio Hummes
people.description: Cláudio Hummes, OFM  is a Brazilian Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church.

people.name: Cláudio Hummes
people.description: Cláudio Hummes, OFM  is a Brazilian Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church.

people.name: Annibale Maria di Francia
people.description: Annibale Maria di Francia, or Hannibal,  is a saint venerated by the Roman Catholic Church.

people.name: O.H.
people.description: Saint Juan Grande Román  was a Spanish Roman Catholic who was a professed religious of the Hospitallers of Saint John of God.

people.name: Luigi Orione
people.description: Luigi Giovanni Orione, F. D. P. , was an Italian priest who was active in answering the social needs of his nation as it faced the social upheavals of the late 19th century.

items.name: Konklave Oktober 1978
items.description: It is a photograph about Konklave Oktober 1978. In a corner, it says:The Papal conclave of October 1978 was triggered by the death, after only thirty-three days in office, of Pope John Paul I on 28 September.   There are names written behind: Vatican_City Giovanni Benelli Giovanni Colombo Cardinal electors in Papal conclaves, August and October 1978 Alberto di Jorio Alfredo Ottaviani Sistine Chapel Vatican City
